plants.name: Rudbeckia hirta
plants.description: A hardy North American wildflower known for its bright yellow petals surrounding a dark brown central cone. Prefers open fields and attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies.
plants.funFact: Black-eyed Susans are often used as symbols of encouragement and motivation.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub or small tree bearing large, showy flowers. It blooms in early autumn in many temperate regions, prized in gardens for its glossy leaves and elegant flowers.
plants.location: East Asia and cultivated worldwide in temperate climates
plants.funFact: Camellias were named after the Jesuit botanist Georg Kamel.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: An Australian native tree producing dense flower spikes with bright yellow, bottlebrush-like blossoms. Blooms in late winter to spring but can flower sporadically year-round in mild climates.
plants.funFact: Banksias are important nectar sources for many native birds and mammals.

plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: A popular ornamental plant widely cultivated for its abundant, colorful flowers. Blooms often peak in early autumn, making it a traditional symbol of the season.
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums are used in teas and traditional medicines in Asia.
